name: Gionbana
overview: Gion Hana ("Gion Flower", named for the Gion region of Kyoto known for its artists and geisha. The game's also known as Gionbana elsewhere) is a hanafuda game originally released in the Arcade in 1989. In 1994 it was converted to the Super Famicom. Like most hanafuda games, it never saw an English localization. The single-player uses a board game motif to connect its games. The player moves around the board earning or losing cash as they play single hands against the CPU.
